meaning: She is worshipped by Shiva, who is known as Kshetrapāla.
commentary: Kshetrapāla is the deity who governs the temple town (kshetra). Kshetrapālas are manifestations of Shiva. The human body is also a kshetra has a kshetrapāla to govern it. This kshetrapāla (Shiva) resides within the intellect (buddhi). Buddhou sharana-manviccha-  He who walks on the path of yoga (path of buddhi) realizes this truth.
